text: Rolling Stones guitarist Ronnie Wood revealed in a new interview that he is now cancer - free after being diagnosed with “ a touch of lung cancer ” in 2017. “ I had three months of check - ups and it was all clear and they said go and enjoy life, ” Wood told Metro. Wood had a part of his lung removed after doctors found “ this supernova burning away on my left lung, ” he said last August. Fortunately, the cancer didn ’ t spread to other parts of the body – “ If that had happened it would have been all over for me ” – and the guitarist didn ’ t require chemotherapy, which was good news as Wood didn ’ t “ want to lose my hair, ” he told Metro. “ If your body is riddled with cancer, it ’ s a losing cause.
